moves.3. Nc3 Qa5 4. Nf3 Bg4 5. Be2 Nc6 6. h3 B: This move isn't in the GK database and, playing something new, I decide to hop around under the queen's radar to defend my king side and pursue the bishop for better or worse.
moves.7... O-O-O 8. Ng3 Bg6 9. Nh4 e5: I played the GK computer in this position and it played 9...e6 instead. Perhaps ...e5 was too bold, but I prolly would of played it myself.
moves.10. Nxg6 hxg6 11. c3: I play c3 to prevent the knight from advancing and to follow up with a gradual queen side attack.
moves.11... Qd5 12. O-O f5 13. Qb3: I offer to trade queens and to double up my pawns figuring that black already has a doubled pawn and it would open up the a file for my rook.
moves.14. Bb5 f4 15. Ne4: I decide to advance the knight hoping to fork at f7.
moves.15... Qd7 16. Re1: A bit of a stall move, but protecting the knight and hoping to win the e4 pawn after Bxc6.
moves.16... Nf6 17. Ng5 Rh5 18. Rxe5: Taking advantage of the knight pinned to blacks queen.
moves.18... Bd6: Here begins a bit of a pickle for me.
moves.19. Bxc6: I capture to make an escape route for my rook and was kinda hoping black would recapture with the b pawn.
moves.20. Rb5 a6: After a bit of analyzing I found there was some hope depite the rook's constant danger.
moves.21. Ra5 b6 22. Qe6+: With two pieces being attacked I check to change the battlefield.
moves.22... Kb7 23. Nf7: The knight finally makes it to f7 though under less ideal conditions.
moves.23... Re8 24. Nxd6+: I expected black to capture with the c pawn, where I would check with the queen at f7 ultimately getting out of my double piece attacked pickle.
moves.24... Qxd6: but black captures with the queen
moves.25. Qxd6: I became distraught at this point because black now has a beautiful mate in two, with 25...Re1+, 26.Kh2 ...Ng4#, although it was easier to swallow this type of defeat for the opportunity of getting out of that pickle.
moves.25... cxd6: But black misses it and the pickle and mate is diverted with white a pawn up!
at this point I could feel all my hard work collapsing around me. Blacks king had infiltrated my camp and I began regretting not giving up more queen side pawns in a desperate attempt to confuse blacks play.
moves.34... Kc2 35. c4: This move didn't occur to me until right before it was played.
moves.35... Ne3 36. Bxe3 fxe3 37. b4: And the lucky set up was complete with my extra pawn advantage coming into play to save the day!
moves.37... Kd3 38. c5: 4 against 3 pawns wins out with black's king forever a space away. Black resigns. Thanks for watching my game.
